ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: It is a very well designed course focused on both the concepts of sampling as well as application in real life. The course would be useful for anyone interested in carrying out research and need to collect data for the same. The best part of the course is that it is not inclined to forestry only but equally relevant to other fields as well.
I really enjoyed the final project and felt that it helped me to better understand many of the principles we learned in lecture.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Integrating more fieldwork into the class, even just on campus, would probably help illuminate difficult concepts for students who don't have a strong mathematical background.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: It fits in well with my goal to acquire quantitative knowledge for natural resource assessment that I am keenly interested in.
It helped me to better understand sampling strategies and their statistical implications. I likely won't use it in a forestry application but think it was still valuable to learn.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To help me in designing my research.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Given that the course material was challenging, it was very helpful to do the final project as a group. As such, I was able to learn from students with more experience and a stronger grasp on the material.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Don't take short cut with the assignments if you really want to cuild your competence in sampling. Assignment helps you understand the key concepts through hand-on learning experience.
